decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing ramp and land tutoring to quickly assemble the combo of Amulet of Vigor with Primeval Titan to generate massive amounts of mana and put powerful lands onto the battlefield. By using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Sakura-Tribe Scout to play multiple lands per turn, the deck aims to bring out Primeval Titan as quickly as possible to search for utility lands like Vesuva, Tolaria West, and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to secure victory. The deck also has Karn, the Great Creator to lock opponents out of the game with artifacts and Turntimber Symbiosis as an additional threat.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow, Scourge of the Skyclaves, and Tarmogoyf early in the game to quickly lower the opponent's life total. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Dismember to control the board and protect your threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows you to recur your smaller creatures from the graveyard, providing additional value and resilience. The deck aims to close out the game quickly by dealing large amounts of damage before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Narcomoeba, Bloodghast, and Prized Amalgam through cards like Cathartic Reunion and Thrilling Discovery. By utilizing cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp, the deck aims to dredge through the graveyard, triggering abilities like returning creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes Life from the Loam to continuously bring lands back to hand, ensuring consistent mana production. The end game often involves explosive plays with cards like Conflagrate and Ox of Agonas.

In this Esper Control deck, the key focus is on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the game and out-value opponents. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells like Mana Leak, Force of Negation, and Cryptic Command, as well as removal spells such as Fatal Push and Kaya's Guile to deal with threats. With a strong land base and access to powerful control cards, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize disruptive creatures and equipment to control the opponent's resources while applying pressure and quickly closing out the game. By combining taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter with removal spells like Path to Exile and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while developing a board presence. The addition of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while the equipment provides additional threats and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through combat damage.

The main focus of this deck is to create a powerful combo using cards like Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. The deck also includes support cards like Conclave Mentor and Auriok Champion to further enhance the combo and protect key pieces. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors and acceleration to quickly set up the combo. This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an unstoppable life gain engine.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures and using disruption spells like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch to accelerate mana production, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful army of creatures. The mana base is designed to maximize the efficiency of casting Humans of multiple colors, ensuring a smooth and consistent curve of threats.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle that relies on efficient removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to apply pressure while also incorporating disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to strip the opponent's hand of key cards. The deck also includes versatile planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to provide additional value and win conditions. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's resources. The deck aims to apply early pressure, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Wrenn and Six. The mana base is built to support the deck's multicolor requirements and includes powerful lands like Blackcleave Cliffs and Raging Ravine.

Utilizing a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats, this Mardu Aggro deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like Lightning Bolt, Thoughtseize, and Lingering Souls, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while chipping away at their life total. Cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Embercleave provide additional threats and ways to close out the game quickly. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize and take control of the game.

This Orzhov Midrange deck focuses on utilizing creatures that can generate value upon entering or leaving the battlefield, while also maintaining a consistent aggressive strategy. The deck includes various creatures with strong synergy such as Gravecrawler and Geralf's Messenger, along with disruptive spells like Tidehollow Sculler and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while the land base supports the deck's color requirements. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent with a steady stream of threats while disrupting their game plan.
